coffee4j

Combinatorial Test and Fault Characterization by @swc-rwth.

Overview Getting Started About

© 2019. EPL 2.0 License.

About

The coffee4j framework is the result of research on combinatorial testing conducted by the Research Group Software Construction (SWC) of the RWTH Aachen University, Aachen, Germany. The published source code is licensed under the Eclipse public license (EPL 2.0).

Contributors

  • Joshua Bonn
  • Konrad Fögen (corresponding)

Publications

  • Konrad Fögen and Horst Lichter: A Case Study on Robustness Fault Characteristics for Combinatorial Testing - Results and Challenges. In: 6th International Workshop on Quantitative Approaches to Software Quality (QuASoQ 2018) co-located with APSEC 2018. Nara, Japan, December 2018. (CEUR-WS)
  • Joshua Bonn: Automated Fault Localization for Combinatorial Testing. Bachelor Thesis at RWTH Aachen University. Aachen, Germany, September 2018. (PDF)
  • Konrad Fögen and Horst Lichter: Combinatorial Testing with Constraints for Negative Test Cases. In: 7th International Workshop on Combinatorial Testing (IWCT 2018). Västerås, Sweden, April 2018. (IEEE, PDF)
 
The website is build with Jekyll using the Hydeout theme. Icon designed by Freepik from Flaticon.
